Always scan your card, and you will save a substantial amount of money over the course of a year. These clubs also apply to places like Subway, local establishments, and some big-box pet stores. So, it is not just groceries.

加入会员俱乐部。许多零售商都提供“购物俱乐部”会员服务，会员可获得专属会员卡。这无疑是节省时间的绝佳方式，尤其适合那些讨厌剪优惠券或打印优惠券的人。加入俱乐部后，只需将会员卡挂在钥匙链上或放在钱包里。结账时，收银员只需刷一下卡，各种优惠就会自动添加到您的购物金额中。这种方式不仅省时省力，还能带来丰厚的回报，最高可达30%至50%的折扣。每次购物都刷卡，一年下来就能省下一大笔钱。这些俱乐部也适用于赛百味、本地商户和一些大型宠物超市等场所。所以，优惠不仅限于超市。

Fully Utilize Your Membership Card. Increasingly, grocers are encouraging shoppers to download coupons for various products directly onto their membership cards. To take advantage of this technology—as a consumer—you simply have to log on to the grocer’s website (using your card’s ID number), and load virtual coupons to your card. The coupon is activated once a cashier swipes the card at the grocery store.

充分利用您的会员卡。越来越多的超市鼓励顾客将各种商品的优惠券直接下载到会员卡上。作为消费者，您只需登录超市网站（使用您的会员卡号），即可将电子优惠券加载到您的卡上。结账时，收银员刷卡后，优惠券即可激活。

Be Smart with Your Smart Phone. Is there anything that smartphones can’t do? Software applications, known as apps, now exist that enable you to save additional money on groceries. In short, these apps act as membership cards on your phone, allowing you to ditch the additional plastic and still reduce your grocery bill.

巧妙利用你的智能手机。智能手机还有什么是做不到的吗？现在有很多软件应用（简称App）可以帮助你节省更多食品杂货开支。简而言之，这些App就像你手机上的会员卡，让你无需使用额外的塑料卡，就能降低食品杂货账单。

Be Aware of Price Reductions. It’s a little-known secret, but many supermarkets will cut the prices on perishable goods as they approach their sell-by dates. If you time things right, you can even combine a price reduction with a coupon. Now, this is also something that people need to pay attention to. If you are living in survival mode, you can go to your local grocer and ask them if they have groceries that are at their sell date, and many times they will give you the food. The best way to use this technique is to approach a store manager and explain your situation. Some stores may be hesitant to do this due to liability issues, but there are a lot of things like bread, cheese, and pasta that have sell-by dates that are perfectly consumable and will keep you and your family fed.

留意降价信息。这或许是个鲜为人知的秘密，但许多超市会在易腐食品临近保质期时降价。如果时机把握得当，你甚至可以同时使用降价和优惠券。这一点也值得大家关注。如果你正处于生存危机，可以去附近的杂货店询问是否有临近保质期的食品，很多时候他们会愿意出售。使用这种方法的最佳方式是直接与店长沟通，说明你的情况。有些商店可能出于责任方面的考虑而有所顾虑，但像面包、奶酪和意大利面这类食品，即使临近保质期，也完全可以食用，足以满足你和家人的需求。

Don’t Forget Lists. There’s nothing wrong with resorting to old-school methods for saving money. Before you head out shopping, make a list of all the coupons you plan on using during your trip. This will help ensure that you don’t forget to take advantage of, say, that coupon for laundry detergent. There are many free apps that can help with this, if you have a smartphone.

别忘了列清单。用老方法省钱也没什么不好。出门购物前，列一张清单，写下你打算在购物过程中使用的所有优惠券。这样可以确保你不会忘记使用优惠券，比如洗衣液的优惠券。如果你有智能手机，有很多免费应用程序可以帮你做到这一点。

If It’s Cheap, Buy a Lot of It. Suppose you stumble upon a super offer for toothpaste—buy two tubes for the price of one. Instead of buying just two containers, think about purchasing four, or even six. By the time you need toothpaste again, there is a good chance that toothpaste will once again be on sale.

如果价格便宜，就多买一些。假设你偶然发现牙膏有超值优惠——买一送一。与其只买两支，不如考虑买四支，甚至六支。等你下次需要牙膏的时候，很可能牙膏又在打折了。

Clear Out the Clearance Section. A store’s clearance section is often full of items that stores are practically begging consumers to buy. In order to entice consumers to take these products off their hands, many retailers further reduce the already marked-down prices of clearance goods by offering coupon deals.

清仓区清仓大甩卖。商店的清仓区通常摆满了商家几乎是在恳求消费者购买的商品。为了吸引消费者抢购这些商品，许多零售商会通过提供优惠券等方式，进一步降低清仓商品的折扣价。

Make the Most out of Grocery Shopping. When possible, try stockpiling goods for about a one-month period. This will cut down on the number of trips you make to the grocery store, saving you both time and money in the process.

充分利用超市购物。如果条件允许，尽量一次性囤积一个月左右的商品。这样可以减少去超市的次数，既省时又省钱。

#↩

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

关于作者

Born in February 1975, Michael Anthony Sciucco, a.k.a. Michael Alden, grew up in Beverly, Massachusetts, where he struggled as a young child to follow the correct path in life. Through the years, Michael was fortunate to learn strategies and techniques that helped him develop a career path that removed him from a life surrounded by crime, drugs, and violence.

迈克尔·安东尼·西乌科（Michael Anthony Sciucco），又名迈克尔·奥尔登（Michael Alden），1975年2月出生于马萨诸塞州贝弗利。他从小就迷失方向，难以找到正确的人生道路。幸运的是，多年来，迈克尔学习到各种策略和技巧，帮助他找到了一条远离犯罪、毒品和暴力的职业道路。

In 1997, Michael graduated from Springfield College with a degree in political science and went on to graduate from Suffolk University Law School in 2003, where he spent three out of the four years on the dean’s list. Michael was general counsel of a large direct response firm for several years and, in 2009, founded Blue Vase Marketing, LLC, a premier direct response marketing firm, where he employs close to 150 people and is expanding his business internationally. Blue Vase Marketing, with an impressive 225 percent growth rate, was ranked by Inc . magazine as one of America’s fastest growing companies in its 500/5000 list for 2013. His company continues to grow and is poised to be the most respected, powerful, and successful direct response firm in the world. Michael is also a host of The Alden Report , which airs all across the globe, discussing the benefits of various products and services. Michael holds several other formal licenses and has also authored publications about the direct response and health and wellness industries.

1997年，迈克尔毕业于斯普林菲尔德学院，获得政治学学位。2003年，他从萨福克大学法学院毕业，在四年的学习生涯中，有三年荣登院长嘉奖名单。迈克尔曾担任一家大型直复营销公司的法律总顾问数年。2009年，他创立了Blue Vase Marketing, LLC，一家顶尖的直复营销公司。该公司拥有近150名员工，并正积极拓展国际业务。Blue Vase Marketing以令人瞩目的225%的增长率，荣登《Inc.》杂志2013年美国500/5000强榜单，成为美国增长最快的公司之一。他的公司持续发展壮大，有望成为全球最受尊敬、实力最强、最成功的直复营销公司。此外，迈克尔还是《奥尔登报告》的主持人，该节目在全球播出，探讨各种产品和服务的优势。迈克尔持有多个专业执照，并撰写了多部关于直复营销、健康与保健行业的著作。
